dcterms:creator: T. Athan
H. Boley
G. Governatori
M. Palmirani
A. Paschke
A. Wyner
dcterms:description: LegalRuleML is a rule interchange language proposed by OASIS, which extends RuleML with features specific to the legal domain. It aims to bridge the gap between natural language descriptions and semantic norms, and can be used to model various laws, rules and regulations by translating the compliance requirements into a machine-readable format.
dcterms:title: LegalRuleML

dcterms:creator: A. D. H. Farrell
M. J. Sergot
M. Salle
C. Bartolini
D. Trastour
A. Christodoulou
dcterms:description: Contract Tracking XML (CTXML) is a language developed for performance monitoring of service-level agreements for utility computing using the event calculus.
dcterms:title: Contract Tracking XML (CTXML)

dcterms:creator: RuleML Inc.
dcterms:description: RuleML is an XML-based standard language that enables users to use different types of rules (such as derivation rules, facts, queries, integrity constraints, etc.) to represent different kinds of elements according to their needs.
dcterms:title: Rule Markup Language (RuleML)

dcterms:creator: ESTRELLA Project
dcterms:description: The Legal Knowledge Interchange Format (LKIF) is an XML-based interchange format language that aims to provide an interchangeable format to represent legal norms in a broad range of application scenarios.
dcterms:title: Legal Knowledge Interchange Format (LKIF)

dcterms:creator: OMG
dcterms:description: Semantics of Business Vocabulary and Rules (SBVR) is an Object Management Group (OMG) standard to represent and formalize business ontologies, including business rules, facts and business vocabularies.
dcterms:title: Semantics of Business Vocabulary and Rules (SBVR)

dcterms:creator: D. Martin
M. Burstein
J. Hobbs
O. LAssila
D. McDermott
S. Mcllraith
S. Narayanan
M. Paolucci
B. Parsia
T. Payne
E. Sirin
N. Srinivasan
K. Sycara
dcterms:description: OWL-S is an OWL-based ontology framework which provides a core set of constructs for describing the properties and capabilities of web services in an unambiguous and machine interpretable way.
dcterms:title: OWL for Services (OWL-S)

dcterms:creator: S. Goedertier
J. Vanthienen
dcterms:description: PENELOPE is a framework for designing compliant business processes with obligations and permissions.
dcterms:title: PENELOPE

dcterms:creator: A. Paschke
M. Bichler
J. Dietrich
dcterms:description: ContractLog is an approach to rule-based monitoring and execution of service level agreements.
dcterms:title: ContractLog

dcterms:creator: D. Nute
dcterms:description: Defeasible Logic (DL) is a rule-based skeptical approach to non-monotonic reasoning.
dcterms:title: Defeasible Logic (DL)

dcterms:creator: G. Governatori
A. Rotolo
dcterms:description: Modal Defeasible Logic (MDL) extends Defeasible Logic with the support of modalities.
dcterms:title: Modal Defeasible Logic (MDL)
